授業目的:
Introducing the basic language functions and grammar needed at the elementary level,
this course will train students to understand short conversations spoken in natural English and to use everyday expressions to interact and share information on themselves, their families, hobbies, school life, professions, travel and daily routines. Training will also be given in the communication strategies used by native speakers in listening and speech acts.
到達目標: To encourage maximum student participation, pair and group work will feature prominently in-class activities, which will include role plays, surveys, and games. While building listening and oral skills, the course will also provide practice in elementary English writing patterns so that students are able to construct simple but effective messages.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Classes will be held face to face unless otherwise directed by school policy.

トピック.授業外学習2:
Students are expected to review textbook units to cement understanding of the topics discussed within the classroom. Students are encouraged to supplement their understanding of lesson material by utilizing the supplementary material provided. Homework is expected to be completed when assigned to further supplement understanding and to allow smooth transition between textbook units.
Students are required to give a short presentation to necessitate successful completion of this course.Some preparatory work will be required outside of allotted classroom time.
